definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: Southeast the Lovelorn Peacocks Fly is a famous long narrative poem in ancient China.
sentences.chinese: 《孔雀东南飞》是一首脍炙人口的中国古代叙事长诗。

sentences.english: The great philosopher Plato is also known for some of his quotations on love.
sentences.chinese: 伟大的哲学家柏拉图也有一些脍炙人口的爱情名言。

sentences.english: Generations of schoolchildren have been forced to memorise his most famous works.
sentences.chinese: 一代代学子都被要求背诵鲁迅脍炙人口的作品和词句。

sentences.english: Authentic Xinjiang mutton keBabs (kaboBs) win universal praise and their fragrance spreads all around.
sentences.chinese: 正宗新疆羊肉串，脍炙人口，香溢四方。

sentences.english: Several tell of the adventures of Sir Tristram and Sir Gawin.
sentences.chinese: 特利斯特拉姆和高文爵士的故事脍炙人口。

sentences.english: Let It Be" is one golden oldie from the Beatles."
sentences.chinese: 是一首披头四脍炙人口的老歌。

sentences.english: Ba Wang Bie Ji is an immensely popular film.
sentences.chinese: 《霸王别姬》是一部脍炙人口的电影。

definition: what's frequently heard can be repeated in detail (idiom)
understood by everyone (idiom); well known/a household name
understood by everyone (idiom); well known/a household name
representative work (of an author or artist)
north and south sides of the Yangtze River (idiom)/(fig.) all over China
to flow right off the tongue (of lyrics or poetry)/to recite with ease/catchy (of a song)
